info.title: Welsh Language Translation Service
info.description: Provides a capability for service users to maintain Welsh translations.  This enables Welsh Language Support for Professional Users; allowing EXUI users to choose to view the UI in Welsh

get.summary: Download a set of phrases potentially associated with a case type for which translations will be eventually added.
get.description: Users calling this endpoint must have the `manage-translations` role

401.description: Authentication failure due to invalid / expired tokens (IDAM / S2S).

403.description:
One of the following reasons:
1. Unauthorised S2S service.
2. User does not have 'manage-translations' role.

put.summary: Upload a set of phrases for which translations may be provided.
put.description:
If user's current IDAM role is `manage-translations`

	 - User can submit English phrases with/without corresponding Welsh translations

If user's current IDAM role is `load-translations`

	 - User can submit English phrases only

If calling service is on approved list of services for this endpoint that don't need to supply  Authorization header: then

	 - this endpoint can be called without supplying IDAM credentials (Authorization header) - Service to Service authorization (ServiceAuthorization header) is still required.

	 - calling service can only submit English phrases

400.description:
One of the following reasons:
1. Bad Request (001 bad schema)
2. Bad Request (002 Welsh not allowed for this user)

401.description: Authentication failure due to invalid / expired tokens (IDAM / S2S).

403.description:
One of the following reasons:
1. Unauthorised S2S service.
2. The request should be from a valid service or the User does not have 'manage-translations,load-translations' role.

post.summary: Get the Welsh translation of the provided set of English phrases.
post.description:
User does not require any specific roles to call this endpoint

This endpoint can be called without supplying IDAM credentials (Authorization header) - Service to Service authorization (ServiceAuthorization header) is still required.
